newsitem.title: UK: Daily LME stock reporting should reduce volatility.
newsitem.headline: Daily LME stock reporting should reduce volatility.

text.p: The switch to reporting London Metal Exchange (LME) inventory movements on a daily basis should reduce market volatility, the LME said in its latest statistical report.
Stock data used to be reported twice-weekly, but the LME moved to daily figure inventory releases on April 7. The impact of this will be monitored over a six-month period.
"It is anticipated that the introduction of daily stock reporting and the resultant increase in stock transparency will reduce volatility in the underlying cash and futures market," the report said.
The LME is first and foremost a fundamentally-driven market, so when there is a large unanticipated stock change it may cause volatility in the underlying market.
